metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12406 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Mozilla Developer Iain Ireland discovered a missing type check during unboxed objects removal, resulting in a crash. We presume that with enough effort that it could be exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.9.0, Firefox < 77, and Firefox ESR < 68.9.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-12406` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 77.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 77.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 77.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.9.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.9.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.9.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.9.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.9.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.9.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '77.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.9.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
